Posts.EditableText:
I know there is a forum that allows users to critique a piece of work and it is up to the artist to deem if it was a fair review or not.  Now I am not sure if the artist's "no", stops the critique from being shown or just gives it a red flag for an administrator to review and they can decide.  After all, unless the critiquer is being a complete jerk, not every review has to be a good one.

As for spoilers, I have seen another forum that made it a rule to post any spoilers with in special tags and the only way to see the spoiler content was to either click on the ready made link or just "highlight/copy" it and it reveals the content.  Of course that would have to be policed and also shown in the first initial greeting of a new person and or a sticky in the rules.  Now what can be done to those who do not follow it on purpose or by simple mistake, I have no idea.  Just suggestions though.
